title: How do i sue my ex husband for unpaid bills
question: because my paralegal didnt fill the paperwork out correctly the judge couldnt do anything. she told me to sue him
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Family law,Contempt of court,Small claims court
answers:
Small claims court lacks jurisdiction over claims that arise under the Family Law Act, including the division of marital debts. The other posting was correct in that you can simply file an Order to Show Cause re Omitted Debt, and ask that the Family Court address the issue. At best though, the Court can only divide and assign to one spouse or the other the responsibility for a community debt. If that spouse then fails to pay, the remedy of contempt is not available (no one can be incarcerated for not paying a debt, only for failing to pay support), and you will need to pay the assigned debt, then seek a further order that your ex-husband pay that amount to you. If he does not, you can enforce the judgment by levy or garnishment.

If the ex-husband is a flake or unlikely to either pay a debt assigned him or t5o be readiy collectible if you have to pay and then go after him, perhaps you need to consideer whether bankruptcy is an option. Not knowing more about your overall situation, I cannot make a recommendation. But you may wish to realistically explore your options. Remember, the best thing about an ex-husband is the "ex". He's no better, he's just not yours.

If your paralegal forgot assets, or debts, from your divorce paperwork, these assets/debts are ommitted.
You can still go back to court, on a motion, and ask for a Judgment on the ommitted assets or ommitted debts.
If the debt was accrued during the marriage, the family law judge still has jurisdiction over this issue.
Go back to court, and get a judgment on that issue.

If you have a Judgment that says that he owe you money, you can sue in small claims for up to $7500. Make sure you can prove everything you are asking for and make sure you have given him proof that you have paid. You must give your ex an opportunity to pay you.
